speech.line: Preserved, a fig! The Lord Cheyne hath preserved him
And bids him to a feast to his house at Shorlow.
But by the way, once more I’ll meet with him.
And if all the Cheynes in the world say no,
I’ll have a bullet in his breast tomorrow.
Therefore, come Greene, and let us to Faversham.

speech.speaker: GRE.
speech.line: Ay, and excuse ourselves to Mistress Arden.
O, how she’ll chafe when she hears of this!

speech.speaker: SHAKE.
speech.line: Why, I’ll warrant you she’ll think we dare not do it.

speech.speaker: WILL.
speech.line: Why, then, let us go, and tell her all the matter
And plot the news to cut him off tomorrow.

stagedir.dir: Arden, his wife, Franklin, and Michael enter. Susan enters separately cleaning.

speech.speaker: ARDEN.
speech.line: See how the Hours, the guardant of heaven’s gate,
Have by their toil removed the darksome clouds
That Sol may well deserve the trampled pace,
Wherein he’s wont to guide his golden car:
The season fits. Come Franklin, let’s away.

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: I thought you did pretend some special hunt
That made you thus cut short the time of rest.

speech.speaker: ARDEN.
speech.line: It was no chase that made me rise so early.
But as I told thee yesternight, to go
To the Isle of Sheppey, there to dine with my Lord Cheyne:
For so his honor late commanded me.

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: Ay, such kind husbands seldom want excuses:
Home is a wild cat to a wand’ring wit.
The time hath been, would God it were not past,
That honor’s title nor a lord’s command
Could once have drawn you from these arms of mine.
But my deserts, or your desires decay,
Or both, yet if true love may seem desert,
I merit still to have thy company.

speech.speaker: FRANK.
speech.line: Why, I pray you, sir, let her go along with us.
I am sure his honor will welcome her
And us the more for bringing her along.

speech.speaker: ARDEN.
speech.line: Content.— Sirrah, saddle your mistress’ nag.

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: No, begged favor merits little thanks.
If I should go, our house would run away
Or else be stolen: therefore I’ll stay behind.

speech.speaker: ARDEN.
speech.line: Nay, see how mistaking you are:
I pray thee go.

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: No, no, not now.

speech.speaker: ARDEN.
speech.line: Then let me leave thee satisfied in this,
That time nor place, nor persons alter me,
But that I hold thee dearer than my life.

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: That will be seen by your quick return.

speech.speaker: ARDEN.
speech.line: And that shall be ‘ere night and if I live.
Farewell, sweet Alice: we mind to sup with thee.

speech.speaker: FRANK.
speech.line: Come, Michael, are our horses ready?

speech.speaker: MICH.
speech.line: Ay, your horse are ready: but I am not ready.
For I have lost my purse
With six and thirty shillings in it
With taking up of my master’s nag.

speech.speaker: FRANK.
speech.line: Why, I pray you, let us go before,
Whilst he stays behind to seek his purse.

speech.speaker: ARDEN.
speech.line: Go to, sirrah, see you follow us to the Isle of Sheppey
To my Lord Cheyne’s where we mean to dine.

stagedir.dir: Exeunt Arden and Franklin. Michael remains.

speech.speaker: MICH.
speech.line: So, fair weather after you: for before you lies Black Will and Shakebag ready in ambush. They’ll be your ferrymen to long home.
But who is this? The painter, my corrival.
That would needs win Mistress Susan?

speech.speaker: CLAR.
speech.line: How now, Michael, how doth my mistress
And all at home?

speech.speaker: MICH.
speech.line: Who, Susan Mosby? She is your mistress too?

speech.speaker: CLAR.
speech.line: Ay, how doth she, and all the rest?

speech.speaker: MICH.
speech.line: All’s well but Susan: she is sick.

speech.speaker: CLAR.
speech.line: Sick? Of what disease?

speech.speaker: MICH.
speech.line: Of a great fear.

speech.speaker: CLAR.
speech.line: A fear, of what?

speech.speaker: MICH.
speech.line: A great fever.

speech.speaker: CLAR.
speech.line: A fever, God forbid!

speech.speaker: MICH.
speech.line: Yes, faith, and of a fool, too.
As big as yourself.

speech.speaker: CLAR.
speech.line: O, Michael, the spleen prickles you.
Go to, you carry an eye over Mistress Susan.

speech.speaker: MICH.
speech.line: Yes, faith, and of a fool, too.
Ay, faith, to keep her from the painter.

speech.speaker: CLAR.
speech.line: Why more from a painter than from a serving creature like yourself?

speech.speaker: MICH.
speech.line: Because you painters make but a painting-table of a pretty wench and spoil her beauty with blotting.

speech.speaker: CLAR.
speech.line: What mean you by that?

speech.speaker: MICH.
speech.line: Why, that you painters paint lambs, in the lining of wenches’ petticoats:
And we servingmen put horns to them to make them become sheep.

speech.speaker: CLAR.
speech.line: Such another word will cost you a cuff or a knock.

speech.speaker: MICH.
speech.line: What, with a dagger made of a pencil?
Faith ’tis too weak.
And therefore thou too weak to win Susan.

speech.speaker: CLAR.
speech.line: Would Susan’s love lay upon this stroke!

stagedir.dir: Susan returns and sees them fighting. Then Mosby, Greene, and Alice enter.

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: I’ll lay my life, this is for Susan’s love.
Stayed you behind your master to this end?
Have you no other time to brabble in
But now when serious matters are in hand?
Say Clarke, hast thou done the thing thou promised?

speech.speaker: CLAR.
speech.line: Ay, here it is: the very touch is death.

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: Then this I hope, if all the rest do fail,
Will catch Master Arden,
And make him wise in death, that lived a fool.
Why should he thrust his sickle in our corn,
Or what hath he to do with thee, my love?
Or govern me that am to rule myself?
Forsooth, for credit sake, I must leave thee.
Nay, he must leave to live, that we may love,
May live, may love, for what is life but love?
And love shall last as long as life remains,
And life shall end, before my love depart.

speech.speaker: MOSBY.
speech.line: Why what’s love, without true constancy?
Like to a pillar built of many stones.
Yet neither with good mortar, well compact,
Nor cement, to fasten it in the joints,
But that it shakes with every blast of wind,
And being touched, straight falls unto the earth.
And buries all his haughty pride in dust.
No, let our love be rocks of adamant,
Which time nor place, nor tempest can asunder.

speech.speaker: GRE.
speech.line: Mosby, leave protestations now,
And let us bethink us what we have to do.
Black Will and Shakebag I have placed
In ambush, close watching Arden’s coming.
Let’s to them and see what they have done.

stagedir.dir: Exeunt Alice, Mosby, and Greene. Clarke and Susan separately.

scene.scenelocation: The Harty Ferry crossing to the Isle of Sheppey.

stagedir.dir: Arden and Franklin enter. It’s foggy.

speech.speaker: ARDEN.
speech.line: O, ferryman, where art thou?

speech.speaker: FERRY.
speech.line: Here, here, go before to the boat and I will follow you.

speech.speaker: ARDEN.
speech.line: We have great haste: I pray thee come away.

speech.speaker: FERRY.
speech.line: Fie, what a mist is here!

speech.speaker: ARDEN.
speech.line: This mist, my friend, is mystical,
Like to a good companion’s smoky brain,
That was half-drowned with new ale overnight.

speech.speaker: FERRY.
speech.line: ’Twere pity, but his skull were opened, to make more chimney room.

speech.speaker: FRANK.
speech.line: Friend, what’s thy opinion of this mist?

speech.speaker: FERRY.
speech.line: I think ’tis like to a cursed wife in a little house that never leaves her husband till she have driven him out at doors with a wet pair of eyes, then looks he as if his house were afire, or some of his friends dead.

speech.speaker: ARDEN.
speech.line: Speaks thou this of thine own experience?

speech.speaker: FERRY.
speech.line: Perhaps ay, perhaps no: for my wife is as other women are.
That is to say, governed by the moon.

speech.speaker: FRANK.
speech.line: By the moon, how I pray thee?

speech.speaker: FERRY.
speech.line: Nay, thereby lies a bargain, and you shall not have it fresh and fasting.

speech.speaker: ARDEN.
speech.line: Yes, I pray thee, good ferryman.

speech.speaker: FERRY.
speech.line: Then for this once, let it be midsummer moon, but yet my wife has another moon.

speech.speaker: FRANK.
speech.line: Another moon?

speech.speaker: FERRY.
speech.line: Ay, and it hath influences and eclipses.

speech.speaker: ARDEN.
speech.line: Why, then, by this reckoning, you sometimes
Play the man in the moon.

speech.speaker: FERRY.
speech.line: Ay, but you had not best to meddle with that moon
Lest I scratch you by the face with my bramble bush.

speech.speaker: ARDEN.
speech.line: I am almost stifled with this fog: come, let’s away.

speech.speaker: FRANK.
speech.line: And sirrah, as we go, let us have some more of your bold yeomanry.

speech.speaker: FERRY.
speech.line: Nay, by my troth sir, but flat knavery.

scene.scenelocation: Open country near the Harty Ferry crossing.

stagedir.dir: Will and Shakebag enter from different directions.

speech.speaker: SHAKE.
speech.line: Oh, Will, where art thou?

speech.speaker: WILL.
speech.line: Here Shakebag, almost in hell’s mouth, where I cannot see my way for smoke.

speech.speaker: SHAKE.
speech.line: I pray thee speak still, that we may meet by the sound, for I shall fall into some ditch or other, unless my feet see better than my eyes.

speech.speaker: WILL.
speech.line: Didst thou ever see better weather to run away with another man’s wife or play with a wench at potfinger?

speech.speaker: SHAKE.
speech.line: No! This were a fine world for chandlers
If this weather would last, for then a man
Should never dine nor sup without candlelight.

stagedir.dir: The sound of horses galloping nearby.

speech.line: But, sirrah Will, what horses are those that passed?

speech.speaker: WILL.
speech.line: Why, didst thou hear any?

speech.speaker: SHAKE.
speech.line: Ay, that I did.

speech.speaker: WILL.
speech.line: My life for thine, ’twas Arden and his companion
And then all our labor’s lost.

speech.speaker: SHAKE.
speech.line: Nay, say not so, for if it be they, they may haply lose their way as we have done and then we may chance meet with them.

speech.speaker: WILL.
speech.line: Come, let us go on like a couple of blind pilgrims.

speech.speaker: SHAKE.
speech.line: Help, Will, help! I am almost drowned!

speech.speaker: FERRY.
speech.line: Who’s that that calls for help?

speech.speaker: WILL.
speech.line: ’Twas none here: ’twas thou thyself.

speech.speaker: FERRY.
speech.line: I came to help him that called for help.
Why, how now? Who is this that’s in the ditch?
You are well enough served to go without a guide, such weather as this.

speech.speaker: WILL.
speech.line: Sirrah, what companies hath past your ferry this morning?

speech.speaker: FERRY.
speech.line: None but a couple of gentlemen that went to dine at my Lord Cheyne’s.

speech.speaker: WILL.
speech.line: Shakebag, did not I tell thee as much?

speech.speaker: FERRY.
speech.line: Why sir, will you have any letters carried to them?

speech.speaker: WILL.
speech.line: No, sir: get you gone.

speech.speaker: FERRY.
speech.line: Did you ever see such a mist as this?

speech.speaker: WILL.
speech.line: No, nor such a fool as will rather be hought than get his way.

speech.speaker: FERRY.
speech.line: Why, sir, this is no Hock Monday, you are deceived. What’s his name, I pray you, sir?

speech.speaker: SHAKE.
speech.line: His name is Black Will.

speech.speaker: FERRY.
speech.line: I hope to see him one day hanged upon a hill.

speech.speaker: SHAKE.
speech.line: See how the sun hath cleared the foggy mist:
Now we have missed the mark of our intent.

speech.speaker: MOSBY.
speech.line: Black Will and Shakebag, what make you here?
What is the deed done? Is Arden dead?

speech.speaker: WILL.
speech.line: What could a blinded man perform in arms?
Saw you not how till now the sky was dark,
That neither horse nor man could be discerned?
Yet did we hear their horses as they passed.

speech.speaker: GRE.
speech.line: Have they escaped you then and passed the ferry?

speech.speaker: SHAKE.
speech.line: Ay, for a while, but here we two will stay,
And at their coming back meet with them once more.
Zounds, I was ne’er so toiled in all my life
In following so slight a task as this.

speech.speaker: MOSBY.
speech.line: How cam’st thou so bewrayed?

speech.speaker: WILL.
speech.line: With making false footing in the dark:
He needs would follow them without a guide.

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: Here’s to pay for a fire and good cheer
Get you to Faversham to the Flower-de-Luce.
And rest yourselves until some other time.

speech.speaker: GRE.
speech.line: Let me alone: it most concerns my state.

speech.speaker: WILL.
speech.line: Ay, Mistress Arden: this will serve the turn
In case we fall into a second fog.

speech.speaker: MOSBY.
speech.line: These knaves will never do it: let us give it over.

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: First, tell me how you like my new device?
Soon when my husband is returning back.
You and I both, marching arm in arm
Like loving friends, we’ll meet him on the way,
And boldly beard and brave him to his teeth,
When words grow hot, and blows begin to rise,
I’ll call those cutters forth your tenement,
Who, in a manner to take up the fray,
Shall wound my husband Hornsby to the death.

speech.speaker: MOSBY.
speech.line: Ah, fine device. Why, this deserves a kiss.

scene.scenetime: In the early evening on the same day.

stagedir.dir: Dick Reede and a Sailor enter.

speech.speaker: SAIL.
speech.line: Faith, Dick Reede, it is to little end.
His conscience is too liberal and he too niggardly
To part from anything may do thee good.

speech.speaker: DICK.
speech.line: He is coming from Shorlow as I understand.
Here I’ll intercept him, for at his house
He never will vouchsafe to speak with me.
If prayers and fair entreaties will not serve
Or make no batt’ry in his flinty breast,
I’ll curse the carl and see what that will do.
See where he comes: to further my intent—
Master Arden, I am now bound to the sea.
My coming to you was about the plot of ground
Which wrongfully you detain from me.
Although the rent of it be very small,
Yet will it help my wife and children
Which here I leave in Faversham. God knows,
Needy and bare. For Christ’s sake, let them have it.

speech.speaker: ARDEN.
speech.line: Franklin, hearest thou this fellow speak?
That which he craves I dearly bought of him,
Although the rent of it was ever mine.—
Sirrah, you, that ask these questions,
If with thy clamorous impeaching tongue
Thou rail on me, as I have heard thou dost,
I’ll lay thee up so close a twelvemonth’s day,
As thou shalt neither see the sun nor moon.
Look to it, for as surely as I live,
I’ll banish pity if thou use me thus.

speech.speaker: DICK.
speech.line: What, wilt thou do me wrong and threat me too?
Nay, then I’ll tempt thee, Arden, do thy worst.
God, I beseech thee show some miracle
On thee or thine in plaguing thee for this.
That plot of ground, which thou detains from me —
I speak it in an agony of spirit —
Be ruinous and fatal unto thee!
Either there be butchered by thy dearest friends.
Or else be brought for men to wonder at,
Or thou or thine miscarry in that place,
Or there run mad and end thy cursèd days.

speech.speaker: FRANK.
speech.line: Fie, bitter knave! Bridle thine envious tongue,
For curses are like arrows shot upright,
Which falling down light on the suitor’s head.

speech.speaker: DICK.
speech.line: Light where they will. Were I upon the sea,
As oft I have in many a bitter storm,
And saw a dreadful southern flaw at hand,
The pilot quaking at the doubtful storm,
And all the sailors praying on their knees,
Even in that fearful time would I fall down
And ask of God whate’er betide of me.
Vengeance on Arden or some mis-event
To show the world what wrong the carl hath done.
This charge I’ll leave with my distressful wife:
My children shall be taught such prayers as these.
And thus I go, but leave my curse with thee.

speech.speaker: ARDEN.
speech.line: It is the railingest knave in Christendom.
And oftentimes the villain will be mad.
It greatly matters not what he says,
But I assure you, I ne’er did him wrong.

speech.speaker: FRANK.
speech.line: I think so, Master Arden.

speech.speaker: ARDEN.
speech.line: Now that our horses are gone home before,
My wife may haply meet me on the way:
For God knows she is grown passing kind of late
And greatly changèd from the old humor
Of her wonted frowardness
And seeks by fair means to redeem old faults.

speech.speaker: FRANK.
speech.line: Happy the change that alters for the best.
But see in any case you make no speech
Of the cheer we had at my Lord Cheyne’s.
Although most bounteous and liberal,
For that will make her think herself more wronged,
In that we did not carry her along:
For sure she grieved that she was left behind.

speech.speaker: ARDEN.
speech.line: Come, Franklin, let us strain to mend our pace
And take her unawares playing the cook.
For I believe she’ll strive to mend our cheer.

stagedir.dir: Alice and Mosby enter arm in arm.

speech.speaker: FRANK.
speech.line: Why, there’s no better creatures in the world
Than women are when they are in good humors.

speech.speaker: ARDEN.
speech.line: Who is that? Mosby? What, so familiar?
Injurious strumpet and thou, ribald knave.
Untwine those arms!

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: Ay, with a sugared kiss, let them untwine.

speech.speaker: ARDEN.
speech.line: Ah, Mosby! Perjured beast! Bear this and all!

speech.speaker: MOSBY.
speech.line: And yet no horned beast: the horns are thine.

speech.speaker: FRANK.
speech.line: O monstrous! Nay, then, ’tis time to draw.

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: Help! Help! They murder my husband!

stagedir.dir: They fight. Shakebag and Mosby are injured.

speech.speaker: SHAKE.
speech.line: Zounds! Who injures Master Mosby? Help, Will, I am hurt.

speech.speaker: MOSBY.
speech.line: I may thank you, Mistress Arden, for this wound.

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: Ah, Arden, what folly blinded thee?
Ah, jealous, hare-brain man what hast thou done?
When we, to welcome thee, intended sport,
Came lovingly to meet thee on thy way,
Thou drew’st thy sword enraged with jealousy,
And hurt thy friend whose thoughts were free from harm.
All for a worthless kiss and joining arms:
Both done but merrily to try thy patience.
And me, unhappy, that devised the jest,
Which though begun in sport, yet ends in blood.

speech.speaker: FRANK.
speech.line: Marry, God defend me from such a jest.

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: Couldst thou not see us friendly smile on thee
When we joined arms and when I kissed his cheek?
Hast thou not lately found me overkind?
Didst thou not hear me cry they murder thee?
Called I not help to set my husband free?
No, ears and all were witched. Ah, me accursed,
To link in liking with a frantic man!
Henceforth I’ll be thy slave, no more thy wife:
For with that name I never shall content thee.
If I be merry, thou straightways thinks me light:
If sad, thou say’st the sullens trouble me:
If well-attired, thou thinks I will be gadding:
If homely, I seem sluttish in thine eye.
Thus am I still, and shall be while I die.
Poor wench abused by thy misgovernment.

speech.speaker: ARDEN.
speech.line: But is it for truth, that neither thou nor he,
Intended’st malice in your misdemeanor?

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: The heavens can witness of our harmless thoughts.

speech.speaker: ARDEN.
speech.line: Then pardon me, sweet Alice, and forgive this fault.
Forget but this, and never see the like.
Impose me penance, and I will perform it:
For in thy discontent I find a death.
A death tormenting more than death itself.

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: Nay, hadst thou loved me as thou dost pretend,
Thou wouldst have marked the speeches of thy friend.
Who going wounded from the place, he said
His skin was pierced only through my device.
And if sad sorrow taint thee for this fault,
Thou wouldst have followed him and seen him dressed,
And cried him mercy whom thou hast misdone:
Ne’er shall my heart be eased till this be done.

speech.speaker: ARDEN.
speech.line: Content thee, sweet Alice: thou shalt have thy will
Whate’er it be, for that I injured thee
And wronged my friend, shame scourgeth my offense.
Come, thou thyself, and go along with me,
And be a mediator ’twixt us two.

speech.speaker: FRANK.
speech.line: Why, Master Arden, know you what you do?
Will you follow him that hath dishonored you?

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: Why, can’st thou prove I have been disloyal?

speech.speaker: FRANK.
speech.line: Why, Mosby taunts your husband with the horn!

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: Ay, after he had reviled him
By the injurious name of perjured beast.
He knew no wrong could spite a jealous man
More than the hateful naming of the horn.

speech.speaker: FRANK.
speech.line: Suppose ’tis true, yet is it dangerous
To follow him whom he hath lately hurt.

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: A fault confessed is more than half amends,
But men of such ill spirit as yourself
Work crosses and debates ’twixt man and wife.

speech.speaker: ARDEN.
speech.line: I pray thee, gentle Franklin, hold thy peace:
I know my wife counsels me for the best,
I’ll seek out Mosby, where his wound is dressed
And salve his hapless quarrel if I may.

speech.speaker: FRANK.
speech.line: He whom the devil drives must go perforce,
Poor gentleman how soon he is bewitched,
And yet because his wife is the instrument,
His friends must not be lavish in their speech.

stagedir.dir: The next day. Will, Shakebag, and Greene enter.

speech.speaker: WILL.
speech.line: Sirrah Greene, when was I so long in killing a man?

speech.speaker: GRE.
speech.line: I think we shall never do it: let us give it over.

speech.speaker: SHAKE.
speech.line: Nay, zounds! We’ll kill him though we be hanged at his door for our labor.

speech.speaker: WILL.
speech.line: Thou know’st, Greene, that I have lived in London this twelve years. Where I have made some go upon wooden legs, for taking the wall on me, divers with silver noses, for saying, “There goes Black Will.” I have cracked as many blades, as thou hast done nuts.

speech.speaker: GRE.
speech.line: O, monstrous lie!

speech.speaker: WILL.
speech.line: Faith, in a manner I have. The bawdy houses have paid me tribute: there durst not a whore set up, unless she have agreed with me first, for opening her shop windows. For a cross word of a tapster, I have pierced one barrel after another, with my dagger, and held him by the ears till all his beer hath run out. In Thames Street, a brewer’s cart was like to have run over me, I made no more ado, but went to the clerk and cut all the notches off his tallies, and beat them about his head. I and my company have taken the constable from his watch and carried him about the fields on a coltstaff. I have broken a sergeant’s head with his own mace and bailed whom I list with my sword and buckler. All the tenpenny ale-houses would stand every morning, with a quart pot in his hand, saying, “Will it please your worship drink?” He that had not done so had been sure to have had his sign pulled down, and his lattice borne away the next night. To conclude, what have I not done? Yet cannot do this? Doubtless he is preserved by miracle.

speech.speaker: GRE.
speech.line: Hence, Will, here comes Mistress Arden.

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: Ah, gentle Michael, art thou sure they’re friends?

speech.speaker: MICH.
speech.line: Why, I saw them when they both shook hands.
When Mosby bled, he even wept for sorrow
And railed on Franklin that was cause of all.
No sooner came the surgeon in at doors,
But my master took to his purse and gave him money.
And to conclude, sent me to bring you word.
That Mosby. Franklin. Bradshaw, Adam Fowle,
With divers of his neighbors, and his friends.
Will come and sup with you at our house this night.

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: Ah, gentle Michael, run thou back again.
And when my husband walks into the fair,
Bid Mosby steal from him and come to me:
And this night shall thou and Susan be made sure.

speech.speaker: MICH.
speech.line: I’ll go tell him.

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: And as thou goest, tell John Cook of our guests.
And bid him lay it on: spare for no cost.

speech.speaker: WILL.
speech.line: Nay, an there be such cheer, we will bid ourselves
Mistress Arden: Dick Greene and I do mean to sup with you.

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: And welcome shall you be. Ah, gentlemen,
How missed you of your purpose yesternight?

speech.speaker: GRE.
speech.line: ’Twas long of Shakebag, that unlucky villain.

speech.speaker: SHAKE.
speech.line: Thou dost me wrong: I did as much as any.

speech.speaker: WILL.
speech.line: Nay, then, Mistress Alice, I’ll tell you how it was:

When he should have locked with both his hilts, he, in a bravery, flourished over his head. With that comes Franklin at him lustily and hurts the slave: with that he slinks away. Now his way had been to have come hand and feet, one and two round at his costard. He, like a fool, bears his sword point half a yard out of danger, I lie here for my life. If the devil come and he have no more strength than sense, he shall never beat me from this ward, I’ll stand to it, a buckler in a skillful hand is as good as a castle. Nay, ’tis better than a sconce, for I have tried it, Mosby, perceiving this, began to faint. With that comes Arden with his arming-sword and thrust him through the shoulder in a trice.

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: Ay, but I wonder why you both stood still.

speech.speaker: WILL.
speech.line: Faith, I was so amazed I could not strike.

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: Ah, sirs, had he yesternight been slain:
For every drop of his detested blood
I would cram in angels in thy fist,
And kissed thee too and hugged thee in my arms.

speech.speaker: WILL.
speech.line: Patient yourself, we cannot help it now,
Greene and we two will dog him through the fair
And stab him in the crowd and steal away.

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: It is unpossible, but here comes he
That will I hope invent some surer means.
Sweet Mosby hide thy arm: it kills my heart.

speech.speaker: MOSBY.
speech.line: Ay, Mistress Arden, this is your favor.

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: Ah, say not so: for when I saw thee hurt,
I could have took the weapon thou let’st fall,
And run at Arden, for I have sworn
That these mine eyes, offended with his sight,
Shall never close till Arden’s be shut up.
This night I rose and walked about the chamber,
And twice or thrice I thought to have murdered him.

speech.speaker: MOSBY.
speech.line: What, in the night? Then had we been undone.

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: Why, how long shall he live?

speech.speaker: MOSBY.
speech.line: Faith, Alice no longer than this night.
Black Will and Shakebag, will you two
Perform the complot that I have laid?

speech.speaker: WILL.
speech.line: Ay, or else think me as a villain.

speech.speaker: GRE.
speech.line: And rather than you shall want, I’ll help myself.

speech.speaker: MOSBY.
speech.line: You, Master Greene, shall single Franklin forth,
And hold him with a long tale of strange news:
That he may not come home till suppertime.
I’ll fetch Master Arden home, and we like friends
Will play a game or two at tables here.

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: But what of all this? How shall he be slain?

speech.speaker: MOSBY.
speech.line: Why, Black Will and Shakebag locked within the counting-house,
Shall, at a certain watchword given, rush forth.

speech.speaker: WILL.
speech.line: What shall the watch word be?

speech.speaker: MOSBY.
speech.line: “Now I take you”, that shall be the word.
But come not forth before in any case.

speech.speaker: WILL.
speech.line: I warrant you: but who shall lock me in?

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: That will I do: thou’st keep the key thyself.

speech.speaker: MOSBY.
speech.line: Come, Master Greene, go you along with me.
See all things ready, Alice, against we come.

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: Take no care for that: send you him home.
And if he e’er go forth again blame me.
Come, Black Will, that in mine eyes art fair:
Next unto Mosby do I honor thee.
Instead of fair words and large promises,
My hands shall play you golden harmony.
How like you this? Say, will you do it, sirs?

speech.speaker: WILL.
speech.line: Ay, and that bravely too: mark my device.
Place Mosby, being a stranger, in a chair,
And let your husband sit upon a stool,
That I may come behind him cunningly
And with a towel pull him to the ground.
Then stab him till his flesh be as a sieve,
That done, bear him behind the Abbey,
That those that find him murdered may suppose
Some slave or other killed him for his gold.

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: A fine device! You shall have twenty pound,
And when he is dead you shall have forty more.
And lest you might be suspected staying here:
Michael shall saddle you two lusty geldings.
Ride whither you will, to Scotland or to Wales:
I’ll see you shall not lack where e’er you be.

speech.speaker: WILL.
speech.line: Such words would make one kill a thousand men!
Give me the key: which is the counting-house?

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: Here would I stay, and still encourage you,
But that I know how resolute you are.

speech.speaker: SHAKE.
speech.line: Tush, you are too faint-hearted: we must do it.

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: But Mosby will be there, whose very looks
Will add unwonted courage to my thought,
And make me the first that shall adventure on him.

speech.speaker: WILL.
speech.line: Tush, get you gone: ’tis we must do the deed.
When this door opens next, look for his death.

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: Ah, would he now were here, that it might open.
I shall no more be closed in Arden’s arms,
That like the snakes of black Tisiphone
Sting me with their embracings. Mosby’s arms
Shall compass me, and, were I made a star,
I would have none other spheres but those.
There is no nectar but in Mosby’s lips.
Had chaste Diana kissed him, she like me
Would grow lovesick, and from her watery bower
Fling down Endymion and snatch him up.
Then blame not me that slay a silly man
Not half so lovely as Endymion.

speech.speaker: MICH.
speech.line: Mistress, my master is coming hard by.

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: Who comes with him?

speech.speaker: MICH.
speech.line: Nobody but Mosby.

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: That’s well Michael. Fetch in the tables:
And when thou hast done, stand before the counting-house door.

speech.speaker: MICH.
speech.line: Why so?

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: Black Will is locked within to do the deed.

speech.speaker: MICH.
speech.line: What, shall he die tonight?

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: Ay, Michael.

speech.speaker: MICH.
speech.line: But shall not Susan know it?

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: Yes, for she’ll be as secret as ourselves.

speech.speaker: MICH.
speech.line: That’s brave: I’ll go fetch the tables.

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: But Michael hark to me a word or two,
When my husband is come in lock the street door,
He shall be murdered ’ere the guests come in.
Husband, what mean you to bring Mosby home?
Although I wished you to be reconciled,
’Twas more for fear of you than love of him.
Black Will and Greene are his companions,
And they are cutters and may cut you short.
Therefore, I thought it good to make you friends,
But wherefore do you bring him hither now?
You have given me my supper with his sight.

stagedir.dir: Michael enters with the gaming tables.

speech.speaker: MOSBY.
speech.line: Master Arden, methinks your wife would have me gone.

speech.speaker: ARDEN.
speech.line: No, good Master Mosby, women will be prating.
Alice, bid him welcome: he and I are friends.

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: You may enforce me to it, if you will,
But I had rather die than bid him welcome:
His company hath purchased me ill friends,
And therefore will I ne’er frequent it more.

speech.speaker: MOSBY.
speech.line: O, how cunningly she can dissemble.

speech.speaker: ARDEN.
speech.line: Now he is here, you will not serve me so.

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: I pray you be not angry or displeased.
I’ll bid him welcome, seeing you’ll have it so:
You are welcome, Master Mosby. Will you sit down?

speech.speaker: MOSBY.
speech.line: I know I am welcome to your loving husband,
But for yourself, you speak not from your heart.

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: And if I do not, sir, think I have cause.

speech.speaker: MOSBY.
speech.line: Pardon me, Master Arden, I’ll away.

speech.speaker: ARDEN.
speech.line: No, good Master Mosby.

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: We shall have guests enough, though you go hence.

speech.speaker: MOSBY.
speech.line: I pray you, Master Arden, let me go.

speech.speaker: ARDEN.
speech.line: I pray thee, Mosby, let her prate her fill.

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: The doors are open, sir: you may be gone.

speech.speaker: MICH.
speech.line: Nay, that’s a lie: for I have locked the doors.

speech.speaker: ARDEN.
speech.line: Sirrah, fetch me a cup of wine.
I’ll make them friends.
And gentle Mistress Alice, seeing you are so stout,
You shall begin. Frown not: I’ll have it so.

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: I pray you meddle with that you have to do.

speech.speaker: ARDEN.
speech.line: Why Alice? How can I do too much for him.
Whose life I have endangered without cause.

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: ‘Tis true, and seeing ’twas partly through my means
I am content to drink to him for this once.
Here, Master Mosby, and I pray you henceforth,
Be you as strange to me, as I to you.
Your company hath purchased me ill friends.
And I for you, God knows, have undeserved
Been ill-spoken of in every place.
Therefore henceforth frequent my house no more.

speech.speaker: MOSBY.
speech.line: I’ll see your husband in despite of you.
Yet, Arden, I protest to thee by heaven,
Thou ne’er shalt see me more, after this night.
I’ll go to Rome rather than be forsworn.

speech.speaker: ARDEN.
speech.line: Tush, I’ll have no such vows made in my house.

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: Yes, I pray you husband, let him swear:
And on that condition, Mosby, pledge me here.

speech.speaker: MOSBY.
speech.line: Ay, as willingly as I mean to live.

speech.speaker: ARDEN.
speech.line: Come, Alice, is our supper ready yet?

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: It will by then you have played a game at tables.

speech.speaker: ARDEN.
speech.line: Come, Master Mosby, what shall we play for?

speech.speaker: MOSBY.
speech.line: Three games for a French crown, sir.
An’t please you.

speech.speaker: ARDEN.
speech.line: Content.

stagedir.dir: Black Will and Shakebag enter, unobserved.

speech.speaker: WILL.
speech.line: Can he not take him yet? What a spite is that?

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: Not yet, Will. Take heed he see thee not.

speech.speaker: WILL.
speech.line: I fear he will spy me as I am coming.

speech.speaker: MICH.
speech.line: To prevent that creep betwixt my legs.

speech.speaker: MOSBY.
speech.line: One ace, or else I lose the game.

speech.speaker: ARDEN.
speech.line: Marry, sir, there’s two for failing.

speech.speaker: MOSBY.
speech.line: Ah, Master Arden, now I can take you.

stagedir.dir: Will pulls him down with a towel.

speech.speaker: ARDEN.
speech.line: Mosby! Michael! Alice! What will you do?

speech.speaker: WILL.
speech.line: Nothing but take you up, sir, nothing else.

stagedir.dir: He stabs and apparently kills Arden.

speech.speaker: MOSBY.
speech.line: There’s for the pressing iron you mocked me of.

speech.speaker: SHAKE.
speech.line: And there’s for the ten pound in my sleeve,

stagedir.dir: Arden falls to the floor, but he rises slowly.

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: What, groans thou? Nay, then give me the weapon.

stagedir.dir: She takes the dagger from Mosby and stabs Arden, killing him.

speech.line: Take this for hindering Mosby’s love and mine.

speech.speaker: MICH.
speech.line: O, Mistress!

speech.speaker: WILL.
speech.line: Ah, that villain will betray us all.

speech.speaker: MOSBY.
speech.line: Tush, fear him not: he will be secret.

speech.speaker: MICH.
speech.line: Why, dost thou think I will betray myself?

speech.speaker: SHAKE.
speech.line: In Southwark dwells a bonny northern lass.
The widow Chambley: I’ll to her house now,
And if she will not give me harborough,
I’ll make booty of the quean, even to her smock.

speech.speaker: WILL.
speech.line: Shift for yourselves: we two will leave you now.

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: First, lay the body in the counting-house.

stagedir.dir: Will and Shakebag lay the body in the counting-house.
Alice takes Arden’s purse and pays them.

speech.speaker: WILL.
speech.line: We have our gold, Mistress Alice, adieu.
Mosby, farewell: and Michael farewell too.

speech.speaker: SUS.
speech.line: Mistress, the guests are at the doors.
Harken, they knock. What, shall I let them in?

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: Mosby, go thou and bear them company.
And, Susan, fetch water and wash away this blood.

speech.speaker: SUS.

stagedir.dir: Tries to wash away the blood

speech.line: The blood cleaveth to the ground and will not out.

speech.speaker: ALICE.

stagedir.dir: Tries to scrape away the blood.

speech.line: But with my nails I’ll scrape away the blood:
The more I strive the more the blood appears.

speech.speaker: SUS.
speech.line: What’s the reason, Mistress, can you tell?

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: Because I blush not at my husband’s death.

speech.speaker: MOSBY.
speech.line: How now, what’s the matter? Is all well?

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: Ay, well, if Arden were alive again!
In vain we strive, for here his blood remains.

speech.speaker: MOSBY.
speech.line: Why, strew rushes on it, can you not?
This wench doth nothing.— Fall unto the work!

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: ’Twas thou that made me murder him.

speech.speaker: MOSBY.
speech.line: What of that?

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: Nay, nothing, Mosby, so it be not known.

speech.speaker: MOSBY.
speech.line: Keep thou it close, and ’tis unpossible.

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: Ah, but I cannot, was he not slain by me?
My husband’s death torments me at the heart.

speech.speaker: MOSBY.
speech.line: It shall not long torment thee, gentle Alice.
I am thy husband, think no more of him.

speech.speaker: BRAD.
speech.line: How now Mistress Arden? What ail, you weep?

speech.speaker: MOSBY.
speech.line: Because her husband is abroad so late.
A couple of ruffians threatened him yesternight.
And she, poor soul, is afraid he should be hurt.

speech.speaker: ADAM.
speech.line: Is’t nothing else? Tush, he’ll be here anon.

speech.speaker: GRE.
speech.line: Now, Mistress Arden, lack you any guests.

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: Ah, Master Greene, did you see my husband lately?

speech.speaker: GRE.
speech.line: I saw him walking behind the Abbey even now.

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: I do not like this being out so late:
Master Franklin, where did you leave my husband?

speech.speaker: FRANK.
speech.line: Believe me, I saw him not since morning.
Fear you not, he’ll come anon. Meantime,
You may do well to bid his guests sit down.

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: Ay, so they shall.— Master Bradshaw, sit you there.
I pray you be content: I’ll have my will.
Master Mosby, sit you in my husband’s seat.

speech.speaker: MICH.

stagedir.dir: Susan and Michael converse apart. To Susan.

speech.line: Susan, shall thou and I wait on them,
Or, an thou say’st the word, let us sit down too.

speech.speaker: SUS.
speech.line: Peace, we have other matters now in hand.
I fear me, Michael, all will be betrayed.

speech.speaker: MICH.
speech.line: Tush, so it be known that I shall marry thee in the morning. I care not though I be hanged ‘ere night. But to prevent the worst, I’ll buy some ratsbane.

speech.speaker: SUS.
speech.line: Why, Michael, wilt thou poison thyself?

speech.speaker: MICH.
speech.line: No, but my Mistress, for I fear she’ll tell.

speech.speaker: SUS.
speech.line: Tush, Michael, fear not her: she’s wise enough.

speech.speaker: MOSBY.

stagedir.dir: Offers a toast with the cup.

speech.line: Sirrah Michael, give’s a cup of beer.
Mistress Arden, here’s to your husband.

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: My husband?

speech.speaker: FRANK.
speech.line: What ails you woman, to cry so suddenly?

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: Ah, neighbors, a sudden qualm came over my heart:
My husband’s being forth torments my mind.
I know something’s amiss: he is not well.
Or else I should have heard of him ‘ere now.

speech.speaker: MOSBY.
speech.line: She will undo us through her foolishness.

speech.speaker: GRE.
speech.line: Fear not, Mistress Arden, he’s well enough.

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: Tell not me; I know he is not well,
He was not wont for to stay thus late.
Good Master Franklin, go and seek him forth,
And if you find him send him home to me
And tell him what a fear he hath put me in.

speech.speaker: FRANK.
speech.line: I like not this, I pray God all be well.
I’ll seek him out and find him if I can.

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: Michael, how shall I do to rid the rest away?

speech.speaker: MICH.
speech.line: Leave that to my charge: let me alone.—
‘Tis very late, Master Bradshaw,
And there are many false knaves abroad
And you have many narrow lanes to pass.

speech.speaker: BRAD.
speech.line: Faith, friend Michael, and thou say’st true.
Therefore I pray thee light’s forth and lends a link.

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: Michael, bring them to the doors, but do not stay.
You know I do not love to be alone.
Go, Susan, and bid thy brother come.
But wherefore should he come? Here is nought but fear.
Stay Susan stay, and help to counsel me.

speech.speaker: SUS.
speech.line: Alas, I counsel? Fear frights away my wits.

stagedir.dir: They open the counting-house door and look upon Arden.

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: See, Susan, where thy former master lies:
Sweet Arden, smeared in blood and filthy gore.

speech.speaker: SUS.
speech.line: My brother, you and I shall rue this deed.

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: Come, Susan, help to lift his body forth
And let our salt tears be his obsequies.

speech.speaker: MOSBY.
speech.line: How now, Alice, whither will you bear him?

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: Sweet Mosby, art thou come? Then weep who will.
I have my wish in that I joy thy sight.

speech.speaker: GRE.
speech.line: Well it ’hooves us to be circumspect.

speech.speaker: MOSBY.
speech.line: Ay, for Franklin thinks that we have murdered him.

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: Ay, but he cannot prove it for his life.
We’ll spend this night in dalliance and in sport.

speech.speaker: MICH.
speech.line: O, mistress, the Mayor and all the watch
Are coming towards our house with glaives and bills.

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: Make the door fast: let them not come in.

stagedir.dir: Michael locks the door and returns.

speech.speaker: MOSBY.
speech.line: Tell me, sweet Alice, how shall I escape?

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: Out at the back door, over the pile of wood,
And for one night lie at the Flower-de-Luce.

speech.speaker: MOSBY.
speech.line: That is the next way to betray myself.

speech.speaker: GRE.
speech.line: Alas, Mistress Arden, the watch will take me here
And cause suspicion where else would be none.

speech.speaker: ALICE.

stagedir.dir: Alice hands the bloody towel and knife to Michael. She begins cleaning.

speech.line: Why, take that way that Master Mosby doth:
But first convey the body to the fields.

stagedir.dir: Mosby removes Arden’s purse, putting it in his pocket.
They bear the body into the fields and return. It’s now begun to snow outside.

speech.speaker: MOSBY.
speech.line: Until tomorrow, sweet Alice, now farewell,
And see you confess nothing in any case.

speech.speaker: GRE.
speech.line: Be resolute, Mistress Alice; betray us not,
But cleave to us as we will stick to you.

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: Now let the judge and juries do their worst:
My house is clear and now I fear them not.

speech.speaker: SUS.
speech.line: As we went it snowed all the way,
Which makes me fear our footsteps will be spied.

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: Peace, fool! The snow will cover them again.

speech.speaker: SUS.
speech.line: But it had done before we came back again.

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: Hark! Hark! They knock! Go, Michael, let them in.
How now, Master Mayor, have you brought my husband home?

stagedir.dir: The Mayor and his Watch enter.

speech.speaker: WATCH.
speech.line: I saw him come into your house an hour ago.

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: You are deceived: it was a Londoner.

speech.speaker: MAYOR.
speech.line: Mistress Arden, know you not one that is called Black Will?

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: I know none such. What mean these questions?

speech.speaker: MAYOR.
speech.line: I have the Council’s warrant to apprehend him.

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: I am glad it is no worse.—
Why, Master Mayor, think you I harbor any such?

speech.speaker: WATCH.
speech.line: We are informed that here he is.

speech.speaker: MAYOR.
speech.line: And therefore pardon us, for we must search.

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: Ay, search, and spare you not, through every room.
Were my husband at home, you would not offer this.

stagedir.dir: Here enters Franklin with a bloody towel and a knife.

speech.line: Master Franklin, what mean you come so sad?

speech.speaker: FRANK.
speech.line: Arden, thy husband and my friend, is slain.

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: Ah, by whom? Master Franklin, can you tell?

speech.speaker: FRANK.
speech.line: I know not: but behind the Abbey
There he lies murdered in most piteous case.

speech.speaker: MAYOR.
speech.line: But, Master Franklin, are you sure ’tis he?

speech.speaker: FRANK.
speech.line: I am too sure: would God I were deceived!

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: Find out the murderers! Let them be known!

speech.speaker: FRANK.
speech.line: Ay, so they shall. Come you along with us.

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: Wherefore?

speech.speaker: FRANK.
speech.line: Know you this handtowel and this knife?

speech.speaker: SUS.
speech.line: Ah, Michael, through this thy negligence thou hast betrayed and undone us all.

speech.speaker: MICH.
speech.line: I was so afraid, I knew not what I did: I thought I had thrown them both into the well.

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: It is the pig’s blood we had to supper.
But wherefore stay you? Find out the murderers.

speech.speaker: MAYOR.
speech.line: I fear me you’ll prove one of them yourself.

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: I, one of them? What mean such questions?

speech.speaker: FRANK.
speech.line: I fear me he was murdered in this house
And carried to the fields: for from that place,
Backwards and forwards, may you see
The print of many feet within the snow.
And look about this chamber where we are,
And you shall find part of his guiltless blood:
For in his slip-shoe did I find some rushes,
Which argueth he was murdered in this room.

speech.speaker: MAYOR.
speech.line: Look in the place where he was wont to sit.
See, see! His blood! It is too manifest.

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: It is a cup of wine that Michael shed.

speech.speaker: MICH.
speech.line: Ay, truly.

speech.speaker: FRANK.
speech.line: It is his blood which, strumpet, thou hast shed.
But if I live, thou and thy complices,
Which have conspired and wrought his death shall rue it.

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: Ah, Master Franklin, God and heaven can tell
I loved him more than all the world beside,
But bring me to him: let me see his body.

speech.speaker: FRANK.
speech.line: Bring that villain and Mosby’s sister too:
And one of you go to the Flower-de-Luce
And seek for Mosby and apprehend him too.

scene.scenelocation: London. A side street near the Thames.

stagedir.dir: Shakebag enters alone, dragging two body bags.

speech.speaker: SHAKE.
speech.line: The widow Chambley in her husband’s days I kept:
And now he’s dead, she is grown so stout
She will not know her old companions.
I came thither, thinking to have had
Harbor as I was wont.
And she was ready to thrust me out at doors.
But whether she would or no I got me up.
And as she followed me, I spurned her down the stairs
And broke her neck, and cut her tapster’s throat:
And now I am going to fling them in the Thames.
I have the gold: what care I though it be known?
I’ll cross the water and take sanctuary.

stagedir.dir: The Mayor, Mosby, Alice, Franklin, Michael, and Susan enter.

speech.speaker: MAYOR.
speech.line: See, Mistress Arden, where your husband lies.
Confess this foul fault and be penitent.

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: Arden, sweet husband, what shall I say?
The more I sound his name, the more he bleeds.
This blood condemns me, and in gushing forth
Speaks as it falls, and asks me why I did it.
Forgive me, Arden, I repent me now:
And would my death save thine, thou shouldst not die.
Rise up, sweet Arden, and enjoy thy love,
And frown not on me when we meet in Heaven:
In Heaven I love thee, though on earth I did not.

speech.speaker: MAYOR.
speech.line: Say, Mosby, what made thee murder him?

speech.speaker: FRANK.
speech.line: Study not for an answer, look not down.
His purse and girdle found at thy bed’s head
Witness sufficiently thou didst the deed.
It bootless is to swear thou didst it not.

speech.speaker: MOSBY.
speech.line: I hired Black Will and Shakebag, ruffians both,
And they and I have done this murd’rous deed.
But wherefore stay we? Come and bear me hence.

speech.speaker: FRANK.
speech.line: Those ruffians shall not escape. I will up to London
And get the Council’s warrant to apprehend them.

speech.speaker: WILL.
speech.line: Shakebag, I hear, hath taken sanctuary:
But I am so pursued with hues and cries
For petty robberies that I have done,
That I can come unto no sanctuary.
Therefore must I in some oyster boat
At last be fain to go aboard some hoy,
And so to Flushing. There is no staying here.
At Sittingburgh the watch was like to take me
And, had I not with my buckler covered my head,
And run full blank at all adventures,
I am sure I had ne’er gone further than that place,
For the constable had twenty warrants to apprehend me:
Besides that, I robbed him and his man once at Gadshill.
Farewell, England: I’ll to Flushing now.

stagedir.dir: The Mayor and the Watch enter, bringing in Mosby, Alice, Michael, Susan, and Bradshaw.

speech.speaker: MAYOR.
speech.line: Come, make haste, and bring away the prisoners.

speech.speaker: BRAD.
speech.line: Mistress Arden, you are now going to God,
And I am, by the law, condemned to die
About a letter I brought from Master Greene.
I pray you, Mistress Arden, speak the truth:
Was I ever privy to your intent or no?

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: What should I say? You brought me such a letter.
But I dare swear thou knew’st not the contents.
Leave now to trouble me with worldly things
And let me meditate upon my Savior Christ,
Whose blood must save me for the blood I shed.

speech.speaker: MOSBY.
speech.line: How long shall I live in this hell of grief?
Convey me from the presence of that strumpet!

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: Ah, but for thee I had never been strumpet!
What cannot oaths and protestations do
When men have opportunity to woo?
I was too young to sound thy villainies.
But now I find it, and repent too late.

speech.speaker: SUS.
speech.line: Ah, gentle brother, wherefore should I die?
I knew not of it till the deed was done.

speech.speaker: MOSBY.
speech.line: For thee I mourn more than for myself,
But let it suffice, I cannot save thee now.

speech.speaker: MICH.
speech.line: And if your brother and my mistress
Had not promised me you in marriage,
I had ne’er given consent to this foul deed.

speech.speaker: MAYOR.
speech.line: Leave to accuse each other now,
And listen to the sentence I shall give.
Bear Mosby and his sister to London straight,
Where they in Smithfield must be executed:
Bear Mistress Arden unto Canterbury,
Where her sentence is she must be burned.
Michael and Bradshaw in Faversham must suffer death.

speech.speaker: ALICE.
speech.line: Let my death make amends for all my sins.

speech.speaker: MOSBY.
speech.line: Fie upon women! This shall be my song.
But bear me hence, for I have lived too long.

speech.speaker: SUS.
speech.line: Seeing no hope on earth, in Heaven is my hope.

speech.speaker: MICH.
speech.line: Faith, I care not, seeing I die with Susan.

speech.speaker: BRAD.
speech.line: My blood be on his head that gave the sentence!

speech.speaker: MAYOR.
speech.line: To speedy execution with them all!

speech.speaker: FRANK.
speech.line: Thus have you seen the truth of Arden’s death.
As for the ruffians, Shakebag and Black Will,
The one took sanctuary and being sent for out,
Was murdered in Southwark as he passed
To Greenwich where the Lord Protector lay.
Black Will was burnt in Flushing on a stage:
Greene was hanged at Osbridge in Kent:
The painter fled, and how he died we know not.
But this above the rest is to be noted:
Arden lay murdered in that plot of ground
Which he by force and violence held from Reede:
And in the grass his body’s print was seen
Two years and more after the deed was done.
Gentlemen, we hope you’ll pardon this naked tragedy
Wherein no filed points are foisted in
To make it gracious to the ear or eye.
For simple truth is gracious enough,
And needs no other points of glossing stuff.
